channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Petrol station closures spark lorry driver row
item.description: Some forecourts closed on Thursday amid a driver shortage that has caused havoc with supply chains.

item.title: Gas crisis leaves Europe searching for solutions
item.description: Consumers face a steep rise in energy bills as governments try to fund the move to renewable energy.

item.title: Sabina Nessa: Murder arrest as police issue CCTV appeal
item.description: A 38-year-old is arrested in Lewisham as police release an image of a second man they are searching for.

item.title: Restaurants set to be banned from withholding staff tips
item.description: The government is set to make it illegal for hospitality bosses to withhold tips from their workers.

item.title: Covid: Cancer backlog could take a decade to clear
item.description: Research identifies 20,000 missing patients in England - and warns more staff and equipment are needed.

item.title: Migrants freezing to death on Belarus-Poland border
item.description: The BBC finds stranded migrants facing sub-zero temperatures amid a row between Poland and Belarus.

item.title: Labour conference: Party pledges to cap foreign sales of new homes
item.description: The party will set out the plan at its annual conference, arguing it will help first-time buyers.

item.title: Gabby Petito case: FBI issues arrest warrant for boyfriend Brian Laundrie
item.description: The indictment says Brian Laundrie used a debit card that did not belong to him after her death.

item.title: Climate change: Construction companies told to stop knocking down buildings
item.description: Britain’s top engineers are urging the government to stop buildings being demolished.

item.title: Catalan separatist Carles Puigdemont arrested in Italy
item.description: Spain accuses the former president of the Catalonia region of sedition, and wants him extradited.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: 'Miracle house' escapes lava
item.description: The volcano on La Palma has been erupting since Sunday, destroying hundreds of homes.

item.title: Seven out of 10 win benefits challenges at tribunal
item.description: More than 287,000 people in three years overturn initial government decision.

item.title: Tom Felton: Harry Potter star collapses during celebrity golf match
item.description: The actor, 34, is carried off a golf course after collapsing during a celebrity match in the US.

item.title: The Papers: Fuel shortage warning and Sussex and the City
item.description: The arrest of a man on suspicion of the murder of Sabina Nessa also makes many of Friday's front pages.

item.title: Homeless in London: 'People pretend they are not there'
item.description: Photographer Anthony Dawton has been documenting London's homeless population during the pandemic.

item.title: Strictly's Rose Ayling-Ellis rehearsing without hearing music
item.description: Rose Ayling-Ellis and her dance partner Giovanni Pernice prepare for their first live performance.

item.title: The Magic Circle appoints its youngest, and first female, president
item.description: Megan Swann, who does "environmental magic" is now the most senior magician in the UK.

item.title: Man's hidden Hornby model railway collection fetches £21k
item.description: Adrian Batty's wife says she had no idea her late husband had amassed hundreds of rare models.

item.title: Meghan and Harry make New York appearance
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex visited 9/11 memorial sites during their Big Apple trip.

item.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK season 3's Victoria Scone on making herstory
item.description: Racers, start your engines. We're saying "hello, hello, hello" to the queens of season three.

item.title: 'How we re-delivered a baby's postcard - 75 years on'
item.description: After an illness, Stu began reuniting old postcards with their owners - and revived some buried memories.

item.title: Singapore migrant workers are still living in Covid lockdown
item.description: The workers in Singapore are enduring one of the longest Covid confinement periods in the world.

item.title: German elections 2021: The conspiracy theories targeting voters
item.description: One wildly inaccurate claim suggests Germany does not actually exist.

item.title: Keir Starmer is taking a big risk
item.description: As Labour conference approaches, Sir Keir Starmer intends to take the fight to his critics inside the party.

item.title: Modi in US: The China factor in India's Quad strategy
item.description: The 'Quad' - India, Australia, Japan and the US - are meeting for the first time as a group.

item.title: Little Boots says Abba's new live band is 'badass cool'
item.description: The pop star is joining Abba's live band next year, after crowd-funding her sparkling new album.

item.title: Spying concerns fuel the market for more secure tech
item.description: Revelations about spyware have spurred interest in more secure phones and software.

item.title: LGBT freshers: 'I worried University of Oxford wouldn't accept me'
item.description: New LGBT students share their hopes and concerns as analysis reveals the extra challenges they face.

item.title: Is 'the worst cold ever' going around?
item.description: As more people mix again, the common cold is back - and leaving people floored.

item.title: Ryder Cup opener 'big for both sides' as Rahm & Garcia face Spieth & Thomas
item.description: Jon Rahm will play with fellow Spaniard Sergio Garcia against Americans Justin Thomas and Jordan Spieth in the opening foursomes match of the 43rd Ryder Cup.

item.title: Knight century inspires England to ODI series win
item.description: Heather Knight leads England to their highest successful run chase in a ODI as they beat New Zealand by three wickets to clinch the five-match series.

item.title: Wenger ready to 'gamble' on match calendar overhaul
item.description: Arsene Wenger says he is prepared to take a "gamble" with his proposals for a new international match calendar.

item.title: Super League: Wigan Warriors 0-8 Leeds Rhinos
item.description: Leeds book their place in the Super League play-off semi-finals after edging past Wigan Warriors in their eliminator.

item.title: 'When we won gold I was expecting overwhelming relief, but it just didn't come'
item.description: Canada goalkeeper Stephanie Labbe says she can now feel pride in her Olympic gold medal after struggling with her mental health.

item.title: England v New Zealand ODI: Heather Knight century inspires series win
item.description: Watch the best shots of Heather Knight's second ODI century as the captain leads England to a three-wicket victory over New Zealand to seal a 3-1 series win.

item.title: Rhys, 13, trains with England cerebral palsy team at Wembley after social media abuse
item.description: Goalkeeper Rhys Porter, 13, has cerebral palsy and was abused online after posting videos of his saves. He was invited to train at Wembley by the FA.

item.title: Covid: How can missing five million be persuaded to have the jab?
item.description: Headlines have focused on teenagers and booster doses - but millions still haven't had a first jab.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Travel update: What are the new rules for holidays in Europe and the US?
item.description: Eight countries have now moved from the UK's red travel lists, to the less restrictive amber.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: People in England could be told to work from home once again through the autumn and winter.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: The torso in the Thames: A 20-year mystery
item.description: Twenty years ago, a young African boy was murdered and his torso was dumped in the Thames. It's the longest unsolved child murder case in the recent history of the Metropolitan Police.

item.title: Paul Rusesabagina: From Hotel Rwanda hero to convicted terrorist
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, who was portrayed in Hotel Rwanda, has gone from national hero to enemy of the state.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Muriel Gardiner: The heiress who saved countless lives
item.description: Muriel Gardiner's courage fighting fascism in Austria inspired an Oscar-winning film. Who was she?

item.title: Hushpuppi - the Instagram influencer and international fraudster
item.description: How Nigerian Ramon Abbas went from a romance scammer to a so-called "Billionaire Gucci Master".
